question: Bialowieza forest lies on the borders of which of the following two nations?
explanation: Bialowieza Forest is one of the largest remaining parts of the primary/primaeval forest of the European Plains. This forest has attained great age without significant disturbance exhibiting unique ecological features. It lies on the borders between Belarus and Poland. This forest is home to European Bison, Europe's heaviest land animal. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
